name: Bloch窶適ato conjecture
rephrased: The Bloch窶適ato conjecture predicts that the rate at which an L-function vanishes at a specific point (its order of vanishing) directly reflects the size of a related arithmetic object called the Bloch窶適ato Selmer group, measured by its rank.
implication_form: If an L-function satisfies certain conditions (like being associated to a pure geometric p-adic Galois representation), then the order of vanishing of the L-function at a specific point is equal to the rank of the corresponding Bloch窶適ato Selmer group.
